description: Borrowed from Ancient Greek χιλίαρχος (khilíarkhos), from χίλιοι (khílioi, “thousand”) +‎ ἄρχω (árkhō, “to rule”), itself a calque of Old Iranian *hazāra-pati-..

entries.meaning: (historical) A commander of a thousand troops in Hellenistic Greece.
examples: And Dadaces, the chiliarch, spear-struck,Forth from his galley leapt with nimble bound.
